name: first-sale-fish
heading: Register as a buyer of ‘first-sale’ fish

index.heading: Ragister as a buyer of 'first-sale' fish
index.guidance:
You need to register as a buyer of ‘first-sale’ fish if all of the following apply:
* you’re buying fish that was landed in the UK
* you’re buying fish or shellfish directly from a fishing vessel
* you’re buying more than 30kg of fish per day

You don’t need to register if you buy fish from a: 
* designated auction site
* merchant or wholesaler (this is ‘second sale’) 
* fish farm

Registering as a business
-------------------------

You’ll need to upload documents to prove the address where you keep your records.

Registering as an individual
----------------------------

You’ll need to prove your identity and the address where you keep your records. You might be able to do this by:
* using GOV.UK Verify 
* uploading documents

use-verify.heading: Do you want to prove your identity using GOV.UK Verify?
use-verify.guidance:
You can use GOV.UK Verify to prove your identity.



If you don’t use Verify, you’ll need to prove your identity with a scan or photo of either:

* your current UK passport

* your current UK or Isle of Man driving licence

* a bank statement from the last 3 months

* a utility bill from the last 3 months



To prove your address you will need a scan or photo of either:

* your most recent council tax bill

* a utility bill from the last 3 months (this cannot be the same as the document used to prove your identity)

proof-of-identity.heading: Upload proof of identity
proof-of-identity.guidance:
To prove your name, upload one of the following: 

* your current passport 

* a current UK or Isle of Man driving licence

* a bank statement from the last 3 months 

* a utility bill from the last 3 months



You can use photographs or scans, as long as the image is clearly legible.



Files can be either JPG or PDF and no larger than 5mb.

location-of-records.heading: Where will you keep records of first-sale fish purchases?
location-of-records.guidance:
To hold a first-sale licence you must keep records of each purchase of first-sale fish for 2 years.

These records must be shown to a marine officer on request.

proof-of-address.heading: Upload proof of address
proof-of-address.guidance:
To hold a licence you must prove you live at, or have access to:

{{data.recordsAddress}}



To prove your address, upload a copy of either: 

* your current council tax bill (or equivalent)

* utility bill from the last 3 months (must not be the same as the one used for proof of name)



You can use photographs or scans, as long as the image is clearly legible.



Files can be either JPG or PDF and no larger than 5mb.

report-purchases-online.heading: Do you want to report purchases online?
report-purchases-online.guidance:
You must submit sales notes for all purchases of first-sale fish.

You will need to give Email address if to report purchases of first-sale fish online.

report-online.heading: What's your email address?
report-online.guidance: Details on how to report purchases of first-sale fish will be sent with your licence.
